content:
CDHR Article 18: "Everyone shall have the right to live in security for himself, his religion, his dependents, his honour and his property."

Comment: CDHR Article 18 touches on the right to security for oneself, their religion, their dependents, their honor, and their property, but it does not specifically address the idea of arbitrary interference with privacy, family, home, or correspondence, nor attacks on honor and reputation. The CDHR does not appear to have an article that directly corresponds to UDHR Article 12.
